title: fix file upload not working against latest pinot controller
body: FileUploadUtils.sendSegmentUriImpl(...) has issue sending segment file URI to pinot controller. In the recent Pinot controller changes, we enforced the checking of "Content-Type" of the requests and reject (by returning 400) the caller if it doesn't contain a valid information. This is usually fine in other Java request code section as Apache Http libs can infer and generate the content type from the entity provided to it. However, when the entity is empty (like the case we have here), it will not generate a proper content-type and Pinot Controller will reject such request. This fix and the unit-test should ensure that file upload request should do the correct thing.

title: Modify hadoop dep
body: In my previous diff for the hdfs fetcher support, I set the Hadoop dep as provided because usually people generally run different versions of Hadoop and better to modify the dependency as needed. However, I noticed this will cause issues in the sample workflow (which is partially fixed in by @jfim [here](https://github.com/linkedin/pinot/pull/1970)). In order to provide user better experience while running the example, I think it is better to make the Hadoop Dep included in pom. The change is tested on local against 2.7.3 Hadoop environment

title: Add support for virtual columns
body:
Add support for virtual columns, which are columns that have no on-disk
representation but instead contain values that are filled in at run
time.

Add support for three built-in virtual columns:
 - $docId: Returns the document id for the current row
 - $segmentName: Returns the current segment name
 - $hostName: Returns the hostname of the current server

These columns can be used for debugging purposes, such as debugging
query routing (which server answered which query) and data issues (what
are the data ranges in each segment).

Additional built-in virtual columns can be added to
VirtualColumnProviderFactory and customized virtual columns can be added
to any schema by adding a provider to the classpath and specifying the
fully qualified class name as the "virtualColumnProvider" property of
the field specification in the Pinot table schema.

title: Fix for a segment having no statistics
body:
If a table is dropped when no rows have been consumed, the statistics will get filled with zeros
and that can cause an index-out-of bounds exception the next time table is created and
consumption starts.

This is because the RealtimeTableDataManager is not removed when a table is dropped.

There are also other conditions that can cause 0 stats to happen, so this PR ensures that
stats returned is never 0.

title: Refactor on-heap/off-heap inverted index creator to prevent leaking resources
body:
1. When inverted index cannot be created, throw exception instead of not creating it (Even we do not throw the exception, it will fail when trying to load it)
2. Add a field "onHeap" (default false) in SegmentGeneratorConfig so we can choose to generate index using on-heap/off-heap generator (currently only apply to inverted index)
3. On-heap inverted index creator does not have the limit on total number of values, so if using heap memory won't cause problems (Hadoop job), should prefer the on-heap creator
4. Add Closeable to creator classes to prevent leaks

TODO: fix leaks for other type of index creators

title: Ignore CONSUMING state in externalview while reporting segment status
body:
It is possible for Idealstate to be in ONLINE and externalview to be in CONSUMING
state (for realtime LLC segments) for a short period of time. The segment status
checker runs every 5 minutes, and for tables that produce segments fairly frequently
it is possible that at any given time, some segment is in this combination of states.

Ignore the CONSUMING state in externalview so that we report alerts correctly.

If a segment is in this combination of states for too long, the alerts from the
server should fire, regarding non-consuming kafka partitions

title: [TE] Remove empty entries from query response
body:
When querying a time series, ThirdEye fills in empty rows to the query response for the time range of the time series. Consequently, it fills in value zero to missing data points, which is an unwanted behavior.

This PR removes the code where the empty rows are filled in.

title: [TE] Dataframe multi index
body:
The current implementation allows only a single index column per dataframe. This limitation can be worked around by using an Objectseries of Tuples, but is cumbersome. This PR adds support for multiple index columns and integrates directly with the existing join and grouping logic.

* multiple index columns (use getIndexSingleton() instead of legacy getIndex())

* join() and addSeries() use multiple index columns automatically

* tweaks to grouping. Still generates a tuple column, but also supports aggregation expression for individual keys.

* Continuation of List<String> and String... interface refactoring

title: [TE] authentication backend fixes
body:

* persist user credentials in encrypted cookie for re-auth if necessary

* add config options for cache and cookie TTL

repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: [PINOT-5350] Protection against file system timeout when fetching segments
body:
It is possible that the controller times out while reading from a (possibly remote) file system.
In this case, the controller already sends out a 200 OK, but the request times out, closing the socket
connection to the server. The server assumes the file received is complete, but untar fails, and an exception
is thrown, resulting in the segment transitioning to ERROR state.

While we can add retries on specific exceptions from untar, it is best to send the content length from the
controller and compare it with the length of the received file in the server. The existing retry mechanisms
will then kick-in, and the file may be received correctly on a subsequent retry.

Tested with the controller not sending the header as well, in case there are servers that talk to the older
controllers

title: [PINOT-5281] Implement relabance API on the controller
body:
Added methods in the controller to rebalance realtime and offline tables.

For offline tables, we rebalance all segments amongst the new instances provided.

For realtime tables, we only rebalance ONLINE LLC segments. The CONSUMING LLC segments
are re-balanced when ValidationManager detects new number of replicas. If all replicas are
OFFLINE then the entries are there only for debugging, so we can leave them as is.

Handled changing number of replicas as well (either increase or decrease).

The numReplicas field in the Idealstate is updated after the rebalance operation,
so that manual update of zk Idealstate node is avoided.

ALERT: Changing the number of replicas AND number of instances with a single rebalance is NOT supported.

Added tests

title: Add dateTimeConvert udf to convert a dateTime column from one format to another, and bucket to given granularity
body:
This udf should be invoked with arguments:
1. Column name to convert eg. Date
2. format(as defined in {@link DateTimeFieldSpec}) of the input column. eg: 1:HOURS:EPOCH, 1:DAYS:SIMPLE_DATE_FORMAT:yyyyMMdd 
3. format(as defined in {@link DateTimeFieldSpec}) of the output expected. eg: 1:MILLISECONDS:EPOCH, 1:WEEKS:EPOCH, 1:DAYS:SIMPLE_DATE_FORMAT:yyyyMMdd
4. granularity to bucket data into eg: 1:HOURS, 15:MINUTES

Tested queries:
select count(*) from tablename group by dateTimeConvert(timecolumn, '1:HOURS:EPOCH', '1:DAYS:SIMPLE_DATE_FORMAT:yyyyMMdd', '1:DAYS')

select count(*) from tablename group by dateTimeConvert(timecolumn, '1:HOURS:EPOCH', '1:MILLISECONDS:EPOCH', '1:DAYS')

select count(*) from tablename group by dateTimeConvert(timecolumn, '1:HOURS:EPOCH', '1:MILLISECONDS:EPOCH', '1:HOURS')

select count(*) from tablename group by dateTimeConvert(timecolumn, '1:HOURS:EPOCH', '1:DAYS:EPOCH', '1:DAYS')

title: [TE] harden alert scheduler against incomplete/incorrect alert configs
body:
The current implementation does not handle unchecked exceptions. A NPE can interrupt scheduler execution and kill the thread silently, e.g. if an incomplete or incorrect alertConfig is processed.

This PR hardens the scheduler and protects the top-level run() method. Furthermore, it gracefully degrades by skipping erroneous alertConfigs rather than terminating execution.

In the long run, TE's job and task scheduling framework requires a major reliability overhaul, e.g. by porting it to Apache Helix.

title: Enable autotune to tune alert filter for a group of functions
body:
When tuning alert filters, the function require some anomalies to run the autotune. However, for some functions, the amount of anomalies is less than the required amount. Also, the criteria of a true anomaly is the same for all alerts labeled by the same team/person. We should be able to tune alert filter for a group of anomaly functions. 

- Modify the endpoint, allow multiple function ids as input
- Modify the output, returning a list of autotune config id
